data1.title: LEAP - Project Completion Certificate
data1.description: Slash_key is a 30 hour hackathon organised by IEEE CS KS. Official website for the hackathon was designed using HTML, CSS, JS and other frontend libraries such as bootstrap and deployed.

data1.title: Kaggle's into to ML
data1.description: Kaggle's Intro to Machine Learning is a beginner-friendly online course that provides a comprehensive introduction to machine learning. You'll learn essential concepts and techniques, including data preprocessing, model training, and evaluation. With hands-on exercises and real-world datasets, this course equips you with practical skills for pursuing opportunities in data science and Kaggle competitions.

data1.title: Kaggle's Pandas Course
data1.description: Kaggle's Pandas Course is a practical online tutorial that teaches data manipulation and analysis using Python's Pandas library. With interactive exercises and real-world datasets, you'll learn essential techniques like data cleaning and transformation. Gain valuable skills in handling tabular data and extracting insights for effective data analysis.

data1.title: Hackerrank Python Certification
data1.description: HackerRank's Python Certification is my pathway to showcasing my expertise in Python programming. It provides a platform to validate my skills in Python syntax, data structures, algorithms, and problem-solving. By conquering coding challenges and assessments, I can prove my proficiency and establish myself as a competent Python developer. It's an opportunity for me to enhance my credibility and stand out in the competitive programming landscape.

data1.title: Aswamedham 2021 CTF WINNER
data1.description: G-Tech Î¼-Learn recently hosted an extensive cybersecurity talent hunt in Kerala called the Aswamedham All Kerala CTF. The competition spanned 24 hours, and our college team enthusiastically participated, ultimately securing the first prize. Working collaboratively, we efficiently tackled the challenges and emerged victorious as a cohesive unit.
